title_sort: william stewart to walt whitman, 17 july 1865
title: William Stewart to Walt Whitman, 17 July 1865
text: Mr. Walter Whitmanâ€”Sir i[I] take my pen in hand to let you know that i[I] am well and i[I] hope that these few lines may find you the same i[I] have not got a way yet from this hospittle[hospital] but i[I] think that my papers will be down tomorrow i[I] think that they will get away this week i[I] think that i[I] have been here long enough now mister whitman[Whitman] tel me what is the matter that you dont[don't] come to see me anymore i[I] hope that dont[don't] keep you away what the ward master told you that night i[I] did not think to ask you to come back Now if you have any lasure[leisure] time, come and see me before i[I] go home. i[I] am sorry that i[I] did not think to tell you to not mind what he told you Well i[I] must [close] My letter by bidding you good by write soonarmory Square hospittle[hospital] William Stewart to Walt Whitman, 17 July 1865
